refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: GTK_STYLE_ATTACHED()
refsect2.programlisting: #define GTK_STYLE_ATTACHED(style) (GTK_STYLE (style)->attach_count > 0)
refsect2.para: Returns whether the style is attached to a window.

refsect2.title: struct GtkStyle
gtk_style_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkStyle* gtk_style_new (void);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkStyle.

refsect2.title: gtk_style_copy ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkStyle* gtk_style_copy (GtkStyle *style);

refsect2.title: gtk_style_attach ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkStyle* gtk_style_attach (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window);
refsect2.para: Attaches a style to a window; this process allocates the colors and creates the GC's for the style - it specializes it to a particular visual and colormap. The process may involve the creation of a new style if the style has already been attached to a window with a different style and colormap.

listitem.simpara: Either style, or a newly-created GtkStyle. If the style is newly created, the style parameter will be dereferenced, and the new style will have a reference count belonging to the caller.

refsect2.title: gtk_style_detach ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_style_detach (GtkStyle *style);

refsect2.title: gtk_style_ref ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkStyle* gtk_style_ref (GtkStyle *style);

warning.para: gtk_style_ref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated equivalent of g_object_ref().

refsect2.title: gtk_style_unref ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_style_unref (GtkStyle *style);

warning.para: gtk_style_unref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated equivalent of g_object_unref().

refsect2.title: gtk_style_set_background ()
refsect2.para: Sets the background of window to the background color or pixmap specified by style for the given state.

refsect2.title: gtk_style_apply_default_background ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_style_apply_default_background (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, gboolean set_bg, GtkStateType state_type, GdkRectangle *area, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);

refsect2.title: gtk_style_apply_default_pixmap()
refsect2.programlisting: #define gtk_style_apply_default_pixmap(s,gw,st,a,x,y,w,h) gtk_style_apply_default_background (s,gw,1,st,a,x,y,w,h)

warning.para: gtk_style_apply_default_pixmap is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: gtk_style_lookup_icon_set ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkIconSet* gtk_style_lookup_icon_set (GtkStyle *style, const gchar *stock_id);

refsect2.title: gtk_style_render_icon ()
refsect2.programlisting: GdkPixbuf* gtk_style_render_icon (GtkStyle *style, const GtkIconSource *source, GtkTextDirection direction, GtkStateType state, GtkIconSize size, GtkWidget *widget, const gchar *detail);
refsect2.para: Renders the icon specified by source at the given size according to the given parameters and returns the result in a pixbuf.

listitem.simpara: the GtkIconSource specifying the icon to render
the size to render the icon at. A size of (GtkIconSize)-1 means render at the size of the source and don't scale.
a newly-created GdkPixbuf containing the rendered icon

refsect2.title: gtk_style_get_font ()
refsect2.programlisting: GdkFont* gtk_style_get_font (GtkStyle *style);

warning.para: gtk_style_get_font is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Gets the GdkFont to use for the given style. This is meant only as a replacement for direct access to style->font and should not be used in new code. New code should use style->font_desc instead.

listitem.simpara: the GdkFont for the style. This font is owned by the style; if you want to keep around a copy, you must call gdk_font_ref().

refsect2.title: gtk_style_set_font ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_style_set_font (GtkStyle *style, GdkFont *font);

warning.para: gtk_style_set_font is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the GdkFont to use for a given style. This is meant only as a replacement for direct access to style->font and should not be used in new code. New code should use style->font_desc instead.

listitem.simpara: a GdkFont, or NULL to use the GdkFont corresponding to style->font_desc.

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_hline ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_hline (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, gint x1, gint x2, gint y);

warning.para: gtk_draw_hline is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a horizontal line from (x1, y) to (x2, y) in window using the given style and state.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_hline() instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_vline ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_vline (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, gint y1_, gint y2_, gint x);

warning.para: gtk_draw_vline is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a vertical line from (x, y1_) to (x, y2_) in window using the given style and state.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_vline() instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_shadow ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_shadow (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);

warning.para: gtk_draw_shadow is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a shadow around the given rectangle in window using the given style and state and shadow type.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_shadow() instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_polygon ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_polygon (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, GdkPoint *points, gint npoints, gboolean fill);

warning.para: gtk_draw_polygon is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a polygon on window with the given parameters.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_polygon() instead.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the polygon should be filled

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_arrow ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_arrow (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, GtkArrowType arrow_type, gboolean fill, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);

warning.para: gtk_draw_arrow is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws an arrow in the given rectangle on window using the given parameters. arrow_type determines the direction of the arrow.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_arrow() instead.

listitem.simpara: the type of shadow to draw
the type of arrow to draw
TRUE if the arrow tip should be filled
x origin of the rectangle to draw the arrow in
y origin of the rectangle to draw the arrow in
width of the rectangle to draw the arrow in
height of the rectangle to draw the arrow in

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_diamond ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_diamond (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);

warning.para: gtk_draw_diamond is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a diamond in the given rectangle on window using the given parameters.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_diamond() instead.

listitem.simpara: the type of shadow to draw
x origin of the rectangle to draw the diamond in
y origin of the rectangle to draw the diamond in
width of the rectangle to draw the diamond in
height of the rectangle to draw the diamond in

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_string (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, gint x, gint y, const gchar *string);

warning.para: gtk_draw_string is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a text string on window with the given parameters.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_layout() instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_box ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_box (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);

warning.para: gtk_draw_box is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a box on window with the given parameters.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_box() instead.

listitem.simpara: the type of shadow to draw

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_box_gap ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_box_gap (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height, GtkPositionType gap_side, gint gap_x, gint gap_width);

warning.para: gtk_draw_box_gap is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_check (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);

warning.para: gtk_draw_check is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a check button indicator in the given rectangle on window with the given parameters.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_check() instead.

listitem.simpara: the type of shadow to draw
x origin of the rectangle to draw the check in
y origin of the rectangle to draw the check in
the width of the rectangle to draw the check in
the height of the rectangle to draw the check in

refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_extension (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height, GtkPositionType gap_side);

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_flat_box ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_flat_box (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);

warning.para: gtk_draw_flat_box is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

listitem.simpara: the type of shadow to draw

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_focus ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_focus (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);

warning.para: gtk_draw_focus is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a focus indicator around the given rectangle on window using the given style.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_focus() instead.

listitem.simpara: the x origin of the rectangle around which to draw a focus indicator
the y origin of the rectangle around which to draw a focus indicator
the width of the rectangle around which to draw a focus indicator
the height of the rectangle around which to draw a focus indicator

refsect2.title: gtk_draw_handle ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_handle (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height, GtkOrientation orientation);

warning.para: gtk_draw_handle is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws a radio button indicator in the given rectangle on window with the given parameters.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_option() instead.

listitem.simpara: the type of shadow to draw
x origin of the rectangle to draw the option in
y origin of the rectangle to draw the option in
the width of the rectangle to draw the option in
the height of the rectangle to draw the option in

refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_draw_tab (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window, GtkStateType state_type, GtkShadowType shadow_type, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);

warning.para: gtk_draw_tab is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Draws an option menu tab (i.e. the up and down pointing arrows) in the given rectangle on window using the given parameters.
This function is deprecated, use gtk_paint_tab() instead.

listitem.simpara: the type of shadow to draw
x origin of the rectangle to draw the tab in
y origin of the rectangle to draw the tab in
the width of the rectangle to draw the tab in
the height of the rectangle to draw the tab in

listitem.simpara: rectangle to which the output is clipped
